Title: Assistive Technology Challenge (ATC)
Short Overview: An applied challenge for assistive technology solutions connecting students with industry partners to co-design accessible tech.
notes: Extracted minimal info; adjust contact if available

Title: Science to Medicine - Impacting Patient Lives
Short Overview: Lecture series showing how pharmaceutical R&D turns discoveries into patient-impacting medical advances.

Title: Strategic Foresight for Sustainable Futures
Short Overview: Methods for anticipating change and shaping sustainable futures through scenario methods and foresight tools.

Title: Case Studies: Energy Systems & Technology
Short Overview: Master course where students tackle real-world energy sector cases across two semesters; companies provide cases and mentorship.
Contact: Dr. Katharina Bosina, Prof. Christian Schaffner

Title: Energy Now!
Short Overview: An innovation accelerator (3 months) connecting students and industry to co-create prototypes for the energy transition.
Contact: Dr. Katharina Bosina, Prof. Christian Schaffner
notes: In-kind challenge contributions; supported by Erde 2.0 Foundation

Title: Transdisciplinary Case Study (TDCS)
Short Overview: Semester-long course co-created with regional stakeholders addressing sustainability challenges through fieldwork and participatory research.
notes: Regional stakeholder collaboration; no financial investment

Title: Umweltproblemlösen
Short Overview: Year-long transdisciplinary project-based learning for first-year Environmental Science students working with local partners.
Contact: Marlene Mader, Prof. Dr. Christian Pohl
notes: Stakeholder collaboration; ETH ethics required for data collection

Title: World Food System Summer School
Short Overview: Two-week intensive exploring sustainable and equitable food systems with field visits and prototyping.
notes: In-kind collaboration through case co-development and field visits

Title: Data Science Lab
Short Overview: One-semester lab connecting students with partners to tackle data-driven projects and prototypes.
notes: Direct project collaboration; partners provide datasets and mentorship

Title: UN Student Team
Short Overview: Extra-curricular student teams working with UN agencies to co-develop practical technology solutions for global challenges.
notes: Supported through private donation; direct collaboration with UN agencies

Title: Entrepreneurial Leadership Seminar (ELS)
Short Overview: Intensive seminar connecting students with senior management to address strategic transformation and innovation challenges.

Title: MTEC Industry Project
Short Overview: Core experiential learning module where master students work on company-defined projects (4 months).
Contact: Prof. Bart Clarysse, Carrie Joda Lyn
notes: High industry involvement; standardized contracts through D-MTEC

Title: Exploration Lab
Short Overview: A flagship program for prototyping and feasibility exploration (4-6 months) with partner-funded collaboration.

Title: Space Systems
Short Overview: Program enabling students to design and analyse complete space missions with industry datasets and mission concepts.
notes: Mission proposals, datasets, and thesis topics offered

Title: PBL Flagship Projects
Short Overview: Large-scale project-based learning across engineering clusters connecting companies with student teams for prototyping and applied R&D.
notes: Scalable interdisciplinary applied R&D; supported by Innovedum Fund
